sn12.2:1.2: “Mendicants, I will teach and analyze for you dependent origination.
sn12.2:1.3: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
sn12.2:2.2: Ignorance is a condition for choices.
sn12.2:2.3: Choices are a condition for consciousness.
sn12.2:2.4: Consciousness is a condition for name and form.
sn12.2:2.5: Name and form are conditions for the six sense fields.
sn12.2:2.6: The six sense fields are conditions for contact.
sn12.2:2.7: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn12.2:2.8: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn12.2:2.9: Craving is a condition for grasping.
sn12.2:2.10: Grasping is a condition for continued existence.
sn12.2:2.11: Continued existence is a condition for rebirth.
sn12.2:2.12: Rebirth is a condition for old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress to come to be.
sn12.2:2.13: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.2:3.1: And what is old age and death?
sn12.2:3.2: The old age, decrepitude, broken teeth, grey hair, wrinkly skin, diminished vitality, and failing faculties of the various sentient beings in the various orders of sentient beings.
sn12.2:3.4: The passing away, perishing, disintegration, demise, mortality, death, decease, breaking up of the aggregates, and laying to rest of the corpse of the various sentient beings in the various orders of sentient beings.
sn12.2:3.6: Such is old age, and such is death.
sn12.2:3.7: This is called old age and death.
sn12.2:4.2: The rebirth, inception, conception, reincarnation, manifestation of the aggregates, and acquisition of the sense fields of the various sentient beings in the various orders of sentient beings.
sn12.2:5.2: There are these three states of existence.
sn12.2:5.3: Existence in the sensual realm, the realm of luminous form, and the formless realm.
sn12.2:6.2: There are these four kinds of grasping.
sn12.2:6.3: Grasping at sensual pleasures, views, precepts and observances, and theories of a self.
sn12.2:7.2: There are these six classes of craving.
sn12.2:7.3: Craving for sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and thoughts.
sn12.2:8.2: There are these six classes of feeling.
sn12.2:8.3: Feeling born of contact through the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.
sn12.2:9.2: There are these six classes of contact.
sn12.2:9.3: Contact through the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.
sn12.2:10.1: And what are the six sense fields?
sn12.2:10.2: The sense fields of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.
sn12.2:10.3: These are called the six sense fields.
sn12.2:11.1: And what are name and form?
sn12.2:11.2: Feeling, perception, intention, contact, and attention.
sn12.2:11.4: The four primary elements, and form derived from the four primary elements.
sn12.2:11.6: Such is name and such is form.
sn12.2:11.7: These are called name and form.
sn12.2:12.2: There are these six classes of consciousness.
sn12.2:12.3: Eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousness.
sn12.2:13.2: There are three kinds of choices.
sn12.2:13.3: Choices by way of body, speech, and mind.
sn12.2:14.2: Not knowing about suffering, the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.
sn12.2:15.1: And so, ignorance is a condition for choices.
sn12.2:15.2: Choices are a condition for consciousness. …
sn12.2:15.3: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.2:15.4: When ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, choices cease.
sn12.2:15.6: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
